CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

1. Electron donor polymers
2. Solar spectrum
3. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM)
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM)
5. Fullerene derivatives
6. Exciton
7. Electron acceptor
8. [6,6]-phenyl-C61 (fullerene)
9. Butyric acid methyl ester
10. [6,6]-phenyl-C71 (fullerene)
11. Butyric acid methyl ester
12. Nanoscale interpenetrating network
13. Polymer
14. Fullerene domains
15. Photoactive layer
16. Effective charge transport carriers
17. Electrodes

The above entities are identified based on their role in the context of the paragraph and their relation to materials.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Electron donor polymers
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM)
3. [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM)
4. Fullerene derivatives
5. [6,6]-phenyl-C61 (fullerene)
6. Polymer

These are the entities that clearly refer to material names in the paragraph.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Electron donor polymers |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

1. High power conversion efficiencies (PCEs)
2. Absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum
3. Energy level alignment with respect to electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM, PC 70 BM)
4. Exciton separation
5. Nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains
6. Effective charge transport carriers
7. Electrodes
8. Solar spectrum
9. Electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM, PC 70 BM)
10. Photoactive layer
11. Polymer and fullerene domains.

The desirable characteristics for electrodonor polymers are:

(i) Good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum
(ii) Optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM, PC 70 BM)
(iii) Formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer
(iv) Provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

So, the property names are:

1. Absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum
2. Energy level alignment
3. Nanoscale interpenetrating network
4. Effective charge transport carriers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum
2. Energy level alignment
3. Nanoscale interpenetrating network
4. Effective charge transport.

These are the material properties mentioned in the paragraph.

| --- |

| Energy level alignment |
| Nanoscale interpenetrating network |
| Effective charge transport |
